transportAdvice: Frankfurt has an extensive public transit network including metro (U-Bahn), suburban rail (S-Bahn), trams, and buses that reliably connect tourist areas, the airport, and city districts. The city centre is walkable for sightseeing, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost; pack warm layers and expect overcast skies.
Still cold with some chance of snow or sleet; conditions begin to slowly improve toward month end.
Early spring brings milder days but temperatures remain cool; a light jacket is essential.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees; showers are common so carry a compact umbrella.
Warm and increasingly sunny; one of the more enjoyable months to explore the city outdoors.
Warm summer conditions with occasional thunderstorms; outdoor dining and riverside walks are popular.
The warmest month with long daylight hours; brief afternoon thunderstorms are possible.
Hot and humid at times with similar conditions to July; stay hydrated and expect some rain.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures make this an excellent time to visit with fewer crowds.
Autumn colours arrive and temperatures drop noticeably; a medium-weight jacket is advisable.
Cool, damp, and often foggy; the Christmas market season begins toward the end of the month.
Cold and festive with popular Christmas markets; snow is possible but not guaranteed.
